meanings.sent1: The tinny toy car had a shiny surface.
meanings.sent2: The metal had a tinny appearance.
meanings.sent3: The tinny teapot looked like a miniature version of the real thing.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed in the tinny room, making it seem even emptier.
meanings.sent5: The tinny taste of the canned soup lingered on his tongue.

meanings.definition: Lacking in depth or resonance, as a sound.
meanings.sent1: The tinny music from the old radio sounded flat.
meanings.sent2: The speaker emitted a tinny sound when turned up too high.
meanings.sent3: The tinny bell rang weakly, barely audible over the noise.
meanings.sent4: His laughter had a tinny quality, lacking genuine joy.
meanings.sent5: The tinny notes of the piano echoed through the empty hall.

meanings.sent2: The knockoff watch had a tinny feel to it.
meanings.sent3: She bought a tinny purse that fell apart after a week.
meanings.sent4: The tinny phone broke after just a few days of use.
meanings.sent5: The tinny fabric tore easily, revealing its poor quality.
